quoteLast: --though the soundings were good--I ordered the engines to be reduced below the half-speed at which she was running.

quoteFirst: The gale came on with some lightning and several claps of thunder and heavy rain. Though it was but
quoteLast: in the afternoon, the air was so dusky that the men had to feel for the ropes; and when the first of the tempest stormed down upon us the appearance of the sea was uncommonly terrible, being swept and mangled into boiling froth in the north-east quarter, whilst all about us and in the south-west it lay in a sort of swollen huddle of shadows, glooming into the darkness of the sky without offering the smallest glimpse of the horizon.
title: The Frozen Pirate

quoteLast: in the morning she fell into a trance. One widow, Turner, who watched with her that night, says that her eyes were open and fixed, and her jaw fallen.
